page.title: 09LAKESIDE HOLIDAY PARK
page.content: IN AS FAR AS THERE IS NO OTHER SETTLEMENT BETWEEN NORTH SOMERCOTES AND THE BEACH THE VILLAGE IS COASTAL BUT IT IS NOT WELL DEVELOPED AS A HOLIDAY CENTRE - THE BEACH IS NOT VERY ATTRACTIVE AND THE SEA IS A LONG WAY OUT.THERE IS HOWEVER A HOLIDAY CAMP ON THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE VILLAGE.IT IS A CARAVAN CAMP WITH A CLUIB AND A LAKE. THE LAST FEATURE IS THE RAISON D'ETRE OF THE WHOLE.IT CAME INTO EXISTENCE AS A RESULT OF GRAVEL EXTRACTION FOR AIRFIELD CONSTRUCTION IN RESPONSE TO THE GERMAN MILITRY BUILD UP IN THE 1930S.PREVIOUS TO THAT THE AREA HAD BEEN USED AS A RSBBIT WARREN BEING OF LITTLE USE FOR ANYTHING ELSE BECAUSE OF IYS POOR SOILS. PART OF THE ORIGINAL WARREN WAS ACQUIRED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION AND PLANTED WITH CONIFERS IN 1960.THIS PLANTATION HAS SINCE PASSED IN PRIVATE
